p: Each sentinel physician collected weekly nasopharyngeal swabs by simple random selection in up to two individuals who presented symptoms compatible with ARI (with no specified case definition) or ILI according to the European ILI case definition [ 8], namely: sudden symptom onset as well as at least one of four systemic symptoms (fever >37.8 Â°C or feverishness, malaise, headache, and myalgia) and at least one of three respiratory symptoms (cough, sore throat, and shortness of breath).
